Articles.Content:
So i've made a bunch of models awhile ago, but haven't had the interest to play ksp or mod for it anymore, so i'm making them available here for anyone who might want to polish them up so they might bring joy and happiness to someone yet.

Contains radial Spitfire part intended for Aviation Cockpits and some sort of Mk 2 sci-fi parts. They should work in-game, but need balancing and final touches etc...

15 minutes ago, ciavelillse said:

So i've made a bunch of models awhile ago, but haven't had the interest to play ksp or mod for it anymore, so i'm making them available here for anyone who might want to polish them up so they might bring joy and happiness to someone yet.

Hello, and welcome to the forums!  And thanks for making a public-spirited contribution for the benefit of all. 

One request:  When you get around to adding a shared link or something for people to download... can you please include license information?  It doesn't have to be a big deal.  For example, if you're making it free and public to everyone forever, you could just state "This work is in the public domain".  Include that both in the forum post where you link to it for download, and also as a "LICENSE" text file in the download itself (zip file or whatever).

(And if you want to put any conditions on it, like "you have to give me credit" or "you can't use it for commercial purposes" or whatever, there are a variety of other license options out there too, if you're so inclined.  "Public domain" is the nuclear option where you are just making them public property.)

Why is this important?  Because you're publishing content, and other people may want to use it in their mods, and mods are required to post licenses, and if you haven't included a statement like that then it's harder for people to use it (e.g. by giving proper legal attribution in their own licenses).

Sorry for the hassle, but it's one of those seemingly little things that actually turns out to be fairly important.

On 4.10.2017 at 6:21 PM, ciavelillse said:

So i've made a bunch of models awhile ago, but haven't had the interest to play ksp or mod for it anymore, so i'm making them available here for anyone who might want to polish them up so they might bring joy and happiness to someone yet.

Contains radial Spitfire part intended for Aviation Cockpits and some sort of Mk 2 sci-fi parts. They should work in-game, but need balancing and final touches etc...

WHO ARE YOU?!
